Reviews.Title: “Absolutely ideal hotel for a few nights stay”
Reviews.Author: TyneAndWearLovebirds
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in Amsterdam on quite a few occasions. Last year we stayed in the lavish Hotel Amrath but this year we went slightly down on our budget and got a very reasonable deal at the Nova. We were definitely not disappointed. The location was superb, within 10 min walk of Central station. Very near to Dam square, but on a quiet section of road. Everything is within walking distance, including a great supermarket if you want to bring a few drinks and nibbles back to your room. The room itself, on the 3rd floor was spacious and very clean, with a large, modern bathroom. We were facing into the courtyard, so not much of a view, but very quiet and full of sunlight. Breakfast was very good, plenty of everything, although the coffee could have been better. This can be remedied by buying a super coffee from the reception area for 1 euro. All in all this was a highly reccommended budget buy.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Quiet room on ground level. Very good location. Good value for the money. We will stay at this hotel next time we go to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the top floor in summer”
Reviews.Author: Beenaround73
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I stayed here in May '09. We arrived into the central station and walked down the Damrak to the Dam Square. Turned right, then left, and then a couple of blocks down to the right was the hotel hidden behind a bunch of trees. The entrance is down a few steps from the sidewalk. Once you get inside the lobby is a good size with a couple of lounge chairs and sofa. There was a separate room off the lobby which was the communal computer room. The reception desk is immediately to the left of the entrance. We were greeted by the receptionist and we checked in quite quickly and were off to our room. Our room was on the top floor facing the street and it was hot up there. We arrived late in the afternoon and when we got up to our room it was hot! We opened the windows and went out to get some food and walk around and figured the room would cool down by then. It didn't. I headed downstairs to get a fan while my buddy took a shower (yes, there's no AC). Front desk showed us where they had some fans and said grab whatever we wanted. Yeah, there was no help, but we knew what to expect from a budget hotel in Europe. So got a desk fan and a floor fan and took them up the room in the elevator. The room was good size to be able to hold 2 twin beds on either side of the room a small desk and en-suite bathroom. The decor was outdated and the beds were not so good. The carpet was bit dirty. The windows were still a little cracked open at night to let the air circulate, but that only let in the noise from outside. All in all the room gave the impression of a 2 star hotel. Since we only needed this place to sleep for a night, we were satisfied with the hotel, but we will probably look for another place next time. We really

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: angela d Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this hotel was good value for money and well located basic but clean the family room was large there was noise from the tram lines being directley outside but would stay here again and would recomend the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: wearytravla
Reviews.Content: Walk to central station and the main square. Breakfast basic but included in the room rate. Very good value .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect position”
Reviews.Author: Luto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the town centre, shopping area, restaurant and bar. It's ideal also for girls travelling alone. The breakfast is good, but they can improve, adding for example different types of bread. The wifi connection (free) didn't work in the room. Available in the lobby, there are 3 internet station. We had only a problem: the room was too hot! The reception staff should smile a little bit more!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic time! Staff are genuine and room was fantastic! Highly recommend it!!! Location was fantastic just a few minutes walk to Dam sq! And a tram ride away from all other major locations! Loved our spiral staircase in our room! Amazing!!! Definatly stay in this same hotel again! 5 stars *****

Reviews.Title: “Clean no-frills great location excellent value”
Reviews.Author: John45_USA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a single room for 3 nights. Asked for a quiet room and got one in back, and it was nice and quiet. Room was very clean. Room was normal size for Dutch standards, but small by American standards. Bathroom is clearly recently remodeled. Nicer than a 3-star I stayed at in Arnhem. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was reliable and a reasonable (but not big) selection. Note: The Dutch do not cook their bacon anything like Americans do (I found this at every Dutch hotel I was at on my trip), so I hope you like it salty and white (fat). If you dig around, you can find some pieces cooked well enough, though. The coldcuts are typical Dutch, but, if you are smart, you'll use them to make a sandwich and take it with you during the day, so you have a good snack -- and save $$$ and time on eating lunch at restaurants. Note: most tourist attractions are only open 10-5, so you need to be quick about lunch, or you'll run out of time. There's a grocery store a block North of the Hotel that you can get cheap food at -- cash only, though. Though the hotel was 2 blocks from the Red Light district, I felt safe out at night ... strong police presence in the RL district (horseback, scooter, bike, and walkers), so it's quite safe (at least until 10pm). Excellent location. Get a pass for the Trams. Get a map from the front desk (free) and don't buy one at Central Station for 2.50Euros. My only complaint would be the wireless ISP. I could log on but their network would drop me from time to time. Annoying. Would take many re-tries and several minutes to re-connect. The trouble is their router, which is not assigning a network address to your laptop. I pointed this out to the staff and he said he'd take it to their network guy, but some other reviewers here have mentioned (earlier) spotty internet wireless, so, I doubt they are doing much about it. Some comments/tips about attractions: Rijksmuseum is closed until 2013. Canal Museum delayed opening until 4/1. Stedelijk museum closed until later this year. FOAM museum is a bust. VanGogh is worth it. Verzetsmuseum (Dutch Resistance) is worth seeing. Amsterdam Hermitage museum was worth it. Canal tour was OK. The regular Amesterdam historical museum is worth it. When ordering meals, don't ask for water, or they give you a 10oz bottle of water that costs 5Euros ($6.50)... clearly specify TAP WATER. Otherwise food was not that bad (I expected horrifically expensive food). Service at restaurants is not as good as it is in the States. Most people speak/understand English wherever I went.

Reviews.Title: “Whirl wind tour of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: geoff l
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, Tues through to Friday. No frills hotel in a great location. We had a triple room on the front which was spacious, clean, and cleaned everyday, With being on the front, you do get the noise from the trams (old wooden sash windows so not good for keeping noise out). But after a hard days sightseeing and a nights entertainment this was only a small issue. The room was well heated and the bathroom, although a bit tight, had recent fixtures and fittings. Room had a fridge which was good for cold drinks but a kettle would have also been welcome. Although you could get tea, coffee and hot water downstairs. Breakfast was spot on. Continental mix of fruit, yoghurt, breads, pastries, meats and cheese but also bacon and scrambled eggs. I loved it and filled up well for the day ahead. We got the train from the airport and the hotel was about 15 min walk. As said earlier, this put you right in the centre and within walking distance of most attractions â€“ the museum quarter was a bit of a walk but itâ€™s nice to be out and about. Would definitely stay here again. A couple of places I would also recommend, Trinity Bar during the day in the red light area â€“ sitting outside watching the tourists going by. And Pizzeria Lagonda (Rozenstraat 143) small, reasonable (as nothing is cheap in Amsterdam) and cheerful Turkish Pizza place!! Sounds a strange mix but it worked for those who wanted pizza and those who wanted Turkish food. Menu only in Dutch but a bit of guess work and a helpful waiter got us sorted.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected surprise”
Reviews.Author: jock2209 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel through online booking after eating some positive comments (and the obligatory poor ones). Hotel easy to get to from Centraal Station on the tram system (1,2 or 5) and it was a pleasant welcome. the hotel is in an old Amsterdam building and therefore full of steep staircases. Our room was found in the middle of one of these staircases which causes my 11 yr old to take very careful steps to and from the room. The room itself was a huge surprise (Rm 28) as it was about 25 yards in length with two distinct bedrooms and a decent bathroom and separate tables and chairs. This would have been ideal for an extended stay in the city but as we were only there for one night it was probably too much space to spread out. Breakfast was typically continental but tasty and filling nonetheless. When we were ready to leave we were able to leave our bags in a room whilst we went to explore. Anne Frank house was only about 10 minutes walk from the hotel. A decent location and decent stay. (One tip for Amsterdam, get the city pass ordered before you leave to visit, you can collect it from the train station, if you are planning to visit plenty of attractions as it saved us a about 70euro as a family and that is not be sniffed at)

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: marron222
Reviews.Content: A small three star hotel with no pretensions that gives more than it promises. A huge room (number 40) with a lovely new bathroom. a lift that takes one up to the 4th floor and a lovely breakfast that gets refilled as soon as anything goes missing. Also very close to everything which meant we never had to use the tram at all.

Reviews.Title: “suprising!”
Reviews.Author: StaceyStandeven
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel by staff at Dial a flight as a standard hotel, no frills but good location, clean and basic. Buffet breakfast comes as standard. It was exactly that. Breakfast was good actually, great eggs..nice selection and was constantly refilled with hot bacon and eggs. The rooms were basic but clean, good size wardrobes and comfy pillows! also we had terrible weather..really bad unexpected snow and the heating was not scrimped on (unlike more prestigous hotels) I was not cold once and I am a moaner if im cold. plus the bathroom was above average (better than the roosevelt in new york city) I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing excelent”
Reviews.Author: Johnny H
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is quiet (except the tram noise all over the day). The beds are confortable, the rooms are clean. The towels were very much used, but well washed (clean). The breakfast is poor and the same every morning: one sort of ham, one soft of salamy, one sort of cheese. There was also 2 sorts of jam. Butter, joghurt, and 2 types of bread. They also serve boiled eggs, omlette and bacon. No vegetables of any kind. Coffee on a machine and milk. They also serve 2 kind of juices. The staff is pretty nice, except a tall reception guy with glasses, who has nothing to do with the calling of hotel occupations. He wasn't rude, but arrogant and not customer oriented (when I checked in, I had to wait more than 2 minutes -which is too much- until he finished a private phone conversation). I would give to this hotel maximum 2 stars (grades). It does not deserve 3, as they claim.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great value”
Reviews.Author: Grth
Reviews.Content: We had a spacious room right at the top of the hotel, Room 40.The room was bright and airy, with long windows on either side. Being at the back of the hotel, there was not much of a view (various scruffy rooftops) but it meant that the room was well away from any street noise. The bed was large and very comfortable and the bathroom was first-class. The buffet breakfast was excellent - scrambled egg and bacon was the cooked option and there was lots of the usual selection of cereals, fruit juices, cheese, cold meats, bread, croissants etc. Breakfast coffee from a machine is usually disappointing, but the machine they have here gives you excellent coffee. They have a similar machine in the lobby. The hotel is located just behind Dam Square and a 10-minute walk from Centraal Station, Most of the things you are likely to want to see in Amsterdam are within walking distance, but the hotel is also on a busy tramline. If you have been to Amsterdam before and you would like to do something different, a recommended trip is a visit to the small village of Zaantse Schans. This village is only four stops on the train from Centraal Station, out into the Dutch countryside. There you can get a wonderful view of a number of working windmills along the canal and you can explore a small settlement of traditional Dutch houses, including a cheesemakers, a clogmakers and various small shops and cafes. Having been in Amsterdam several times before and stayed in different hotels, I would definitely stay in the Nova Hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bvwinbristol
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, huge bed, ours was at the front of the hotel with good view. Buffet breakfast was excellent, cereals, cold meats etc, eggs, bacon, fruit, rolls, cakes..enough to satisfy most tastes i guess. The location is excellent, just a few yards to Dam square and very close to 2 tram stops.. Dam Square and Spui. The Staff were very friendly and helpful, as were everyone we met in Amsterdam. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Pinto-Town
Reviews.Content: If you're not fussy about having a room with a view (because that's the only drawback if you get a back room), this is the perfect hotel. You'll get a spacious room and bathroom, everything will be clean and the bed will be big and comfortable. Breakfast is more than acceptable, especially considering the prize, and lastly you will get a kind and helpful staff. I loved having free access to the Internet on their Macs! Furthermore,You're right at the town centre ( two minutes to Dam Square and ten to Central Station) and there are three trams which stop right at the hotel door. In short, I would stay again if I had the chance to visit the city for a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, facilities are fine, staff are amazing.”
Reviews.Author: melonfawn
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were what really made me like this hotel more than I could have. They were so friendly and eager to help in any way they could, even posting my letters after their shift had finished which went above and beyond! Beware if you need internet access... I had booked this hotel on the basis that they had wifi, but found my room was never connected. A quick call to the front desk confirmed neither my room nor the one next door got wifi. This wasn't a huge pain for me (they do have 2 communal computers downstairs) but it would've been nice to get what I paid for, and definitely a point to note for business travellers or people who need to be more connected. The rooms are older but clean. I'd stay here again if the price was right, but wouldn't feel a particular loyalty to this hotel over others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Kylie C
Reviews.Content: We booked Nova Hotel after walking out on the accommodation we had booked at the Amsterdam Inn B & B, which was absolutely terrible. The Nova hotel staff were friendly, the room was large with a huge 3 cnr bath in bathroom. We had free wifi in our room. This hotel is very central and easy to walk everywhere. Breakfast was included and was very nice. The staff were friendly and helped with all our queries. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, pity about the neon”
Reviews.Author: canuckfan491
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fairly inexpensive, provided 'typical' continental free breakfast (it ain't full english), near Felix Mertis, couple of museums, best beer bar in Amsterdam. Spacious rooms, friendly staff, international clientele. Quiet rooms, but that neon sign in front! (and the trams in the morning....)

Reviews.Title: “Noisey, but clean and close to night life.”
Reviews.Author: Blue C
Reviews.Content: I was really surprise with my room. For what I payed for my 3 night stay in Amsterdam, was really worth it. Had a small room (typical), but space excellent for one person and my bathroom was clean with a nice size shower. My towels appeared dirty, with a few holes, but had them replaced easily by asking. My room was facing the train, so until about 7am-1am, the dinging of the train was loud, but honestly I only knew that because my first night I stayed in, but other nights well, liquid sleep, also keeping my window open I could get high. The 7am train was a good alarm though. The breakfast that was served was pretty good and included in my price. Overall, I would stay at the hotel again (once the price is right) and hopefully will take my partner to this hotel, because of cleanliness and how close it was to resturants and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Roamingdolly
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well placed for station, Dam Square and main canal areas. Trams from outside the hotel serve the main areas (and station) if you DO need them. Staff were all very pleasant and helpful - requests for an extra pillow and plug for the bathroom sink were dealt with promptly and with a smile. Yes - it is a warrren as, like many hotels in A/dam, it is spread over several buildings but there is a lft and you soon get the hang of finding your room. Our bedroom (304) and the bathroom were a good size. It was very quiet - with a view of an inner courtyard (and the windows opposite) but that didn't bother us. The room was hot at times so we left the windows open at night. Beds were very comfortable. A fridge (working), TV, safe and hairdryer were provided. Breakfasts were more than adequate with reasonable choices. There was hot food if you want a cooked breakfast but the cold buffet was good - cold meats and cheeses were 'real' and not 'plastic. Breads were varied and fresh. The nearby supermarket was useful for milk etc. Tip: get Dutch waffles in a pretty bue and white tin as gifts from here - much cheaper than the souvenir shops. Treat yourself to late afternoon coffee and scrumptous cakes and apple tart at the ground floor cafe in De Bijenkorf in Dam Square to keep you going until your evening meal (cost about 6 euro). Nearby restaurants include Humphreys at 312 who do a menu for 23.95 euro with plenty of choice and also do try La Piccola Trattoria at number 346. It is a lovely little Italian resturant run by two brothers and it is a little gem - 2 can eat well for 24 euro - including wine. Word of warnIng - the ticket machines at the rail stations to and from the airport only seem to take cards. If you are paying cash you need to queue at the ticket office.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter0511
Reviews.Content: Just back from three nights at the Nova Hotel. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from Central station and 5 minutes from Dam Square. The staff are very helpful and we ended up in a great big triple room facing the front of the hotel. Only one complaint was the noise of the trams first thing in the morning but other than that it was a great trip. Good choice for breakfast and it the hotel has the best shower.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: entucasa
Reviews.Content: It is a "do it yourself " hotel hardly worth more than a 1 star rating. At nearly 400 euro a night in August, I think there are better options. I know that generally European hotel rooms are small, but whoever decided to re furbish the rooms, did not have a clue. For starters, you have to lug your luggage down 6 stairs to get into the lobby which is usually crowded and very small. Rooms were very basic with "Ikea" style furnishings and so you trip over everything. The bathrooms were brand new, the only plus. If you get a courtyard room, don't look out the window. All you see are crumbling walls and a miserable courtyard. We asked for an early wake up call which the desk clerk forgot to do as well as order our taxi so it was a mad rush to get up and out of there to the airport. The breakfast room was in a room without windows, with unimaginative Formica tables and chairs, a totally unappealing place to eat the awful "serve yourself" buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “We'll came back”
Reviews.Author: Elisamerla
Reviews.Content: Great location in the city center from which we visited Amsterdam on foot. Just 10 minutes walk to the central station, where you can take trains/ferryboat /bikes for the surroundings (I loved Enkhuizen!). Small room, but silent. Generous breakfast buffet. Useful computer to print tickets online for museum!

Reviews.Title: “Queen's neighbors feel or "location, location, location"”
Reviews.Author: Cirrus22
Reviews.Content: We returned 25 march from Amsterdam and we were eager to recommend the Nova 3 star hotel located just behind the Queen's Palace on Dam Square. Its location allows walking minutes from the Anne Frank Museum Amsterdam's history, Rembrandt Square, the Botanical Gardens and the Zoo and the Portuguese Jewish Synagogue and the Jewish Museum. Hotel good breakfast (fresh juices, eggs, Korasonim and selection of breads and rolls, cornflakes various types of cheeses and yogurts, but no vegetables. Room (304) was still large 6X4 feet and equipped with all you need including refrigerator. Just finding the room was a bit difficult thicket of buildings that are connected in various corridors of each door (4 small corridors and four different doors until we came into the room. problem! and I clearly think that if Anne Frank was hiding him they did not find it until today.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: UNCfanVal
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about this hotel. The staff were friendly, helpful and spoke English. We got there pretty early and our room was ready. We had a triple room on the first floor. It was very large and had a great high ceiling. The front was all windows. The bathroom looked like it had recently been renovated and was very modern in style. The sink and toilet were higher than most places which was fine for us since we're tall. The shower was a walk in. It was the best shower on our trip and large even for American standards. The room has an empty fridge so you can chill your water and whatnot. They also provide a full size hair dryer. The beds were very comfy, the best on our trip. The tv has many English channels. We had a front room and I thought the noise of the trams going by would wake me up or make it hard to fall asleep. They didn't. Once I was asleep I never once woke up from their noise. The hotel also has free wifi and they provide the password in the binder of info in your room. The breakfast was good. It was your standard European breakfast. One thing I liked was that they buzzed you in. It made me feel safe knowing not just anyone would be walking into the hotel at night. The location was amazing. It was a street over from Dam Square. It took about 3 min to walk to it. There were restaurants and shops nearby. There are plenty of ATMs nearby as well. Its about a 5-10 min walk to the area near the train station for the canal tours and hop on hop off buses. It's also close walking distance to the Anne Frank house and the flower markets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location at Nova”
Reviews.Author: B0nnySc0tland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in May and found this hotel more than met our expectations. It's location is brilliant as you are only a few minutes walk from Dam square. The street it is situated on is lovely and there are a few bars and a supermarket nearby. The rooms are very big and have a fridge which was useful to chill our drinks. The staff in the hotel were lovely too. We had the breakfast and found this to be fresh and plentiful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location for the Price”
Reviews.Author: smarty74
Reviews.Content: Very reasonably priced compared to other hotels (about 90-100 euros a night for a 2 person room), good sized rooms in a central old town location but away enough from the partying. Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper and have a room facing the street because there are several trams that run down the street. An elevator, own bathroom, good complimentary breakfast, 24/7 front desk, and pretty comfortable beds. Everything I would want out of a centrally located hotel at that price. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eveeeee
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with 2 of my friends and it was a truly satisfying experience. We stayed on the 4th floor in a quiet room with 1 king bed and 1 single bed. what i really liked is the fact the the single bed wasn't a foldable extra bed, instead a normal sized wooden bed. The room was basic but truly spacious especially for a traditional Amsterdam-style house-turned-hotel. The maids cleaned daily and we always had fresh towels. The breakfast was also basic but everything was fresh, especially the bread. As for the staff, they were always friendly and helpful. The hotel is located on a quiet street right next to the Dam Square which puts Nova in a great central location. Free WiFi and a supermarket steps away are big pluses.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly base for your Amsterdam visit”
Reviews.Author: RoyCale
Reviews.Content: Our room was large and clean and the staff was friendly. Many sights and shopping areas of Amsterdam are within walking range. Breakfast sortiment was simple but good quality. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to someone with a walking disability or wheelchair, since the layout resembles a maze: there are a lot of cramped corridors, stairs and doors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location 1 minute to Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: FiftyishWales
Reviews.Content: Couldn't find anything to complain about, the location was perfect; walking distance to everywhere. Breakfast was plentiful. All the staff were pleasant especially the ones on reception. The room was spacious and adequate. Had a great rate on Late rooms so at 79euros this hotel was a bargain. The free internet in the foyer and Wifi in the rooms was an added bonus. The restaurant just up the street (next door to Humphreys has exellent food)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,central,clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Isobel65
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Booked 1single and 1 twin room and on arrival found we had been allocated a room with a double bed which was unsuitable, there was no problem and immediately offered a twin room which was spacious,clean,comfortable with modern shower and bathroom and had a TV and fridge. The staff were very friendly and helpful ,ordered taxis for us and gave us advice and clear directions when asked. The buffet breakfast was excellent, with a vast variety cereals,fresh fruit &juices ,cold meats,cheeses,hot bacon & eggs as well as the usual toast, bread buns,etc and tea and coffee, all replenished swiftly by the staff. It had a central location,served by bus and trams and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location!!”
Reviews.Author: kalevet
Reviews.Content: Very very pleased with my choice of hotel. Nova is centrally located in Amsterdam - near to Dam Square, Red Light District, Centraal Station, Anne Frank Huis etc you can reach these areas in 5-10 minutes by walking. The rooms are spacious, clean and was warm when we got in. In our room there was a large fridge, safe, TV (with lots of channels), desk, table, chairs, hair dryer and free high speed Wi-Fi. Very nice and much more than I expected. The bathroom is a good sized too - clean and warm. However, there is no complimentary shampoo (there is free shower caps and shoe shine though) but that's not too important as we brought just enough shampoo for a few days. (There is a supermarket nearby also) Beds were comfortable and I slept well however you could hear trams go by if you were facing the main street so if you need 100% silence to sleep - I suggest not getting the front rooms. The reception staff were very friendly, helpful and were present 24hrs a day. There are 3 iMac computers in the lobby - free of charge to use. Also there is a coffee and tea machine in the lobby. Breakfast was very good - fresh bread, pastries, eggs, bacon, juice, hot chocolate: the choice was wide and I enjoyed my breakfast for the first time in a European hotel! I would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to stay in the heart of Amsterdam within walking distance of everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: ld3363
Reviews.Content: the hotel location is great, the rooms are clean and comfortable with lovely modern bathrooms and good showers. There is no tea or coffee making facilities in the room but you can get this in the foyer. Breakfast is very good with plenty of variety we we surprised how much was on offer. staff were very friendly and helpful - would definitely stay here again. the hotel is nice and quiet but you will get a lot of noise from outside e.g. trams and people but it's right in the city so that's to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: annabell64
Reviews.Content: Great Location, excellent value for money. Great breakfast, massive bedroom and friendly staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: buntymc Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: A group of six lads who all like quality !. Great location we thought it was fantastic, good rooms nice and CLEAN. Staff were very friendly, nothing was to much trouble. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for friends getaway”
Reviews.Author: NoamSP
Reviews.Content: 5 nights stay with 2 friends during Dec. 2010. Nova is located in the center of everything and is in walking distance from all the shopping areas, the clubs and all the attractions. For the non-walkers, there is a bus station that will take you anywhere just outside the hotel. Nova provides free Wi-Fi for it's guests, free warm drinks and free use in great computers and a printer in the lobby. The hotel is a bit oddly organized, but the rooms are very big, the beds are cofortoble and it really all you need while traveling with friends or alone. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: RICARBSAS
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, good location colse to Dam Square. big and clean room, nice street view. Complete breakfast. Free Wi Fi at the lobby and in your room. Good staff, very helpful. Adeccuate fare. We will return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: JoxerBrown
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Nova Hotel for 2 nights in November. The staff were very friendly, the hotel was very clean and the rooms was perfect for what we paid

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: ceyda83
Reviews.Content: Nice and helpfull staff, good location.. just 5 min. to Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel , fine service”
Reviews.Author: FarhanGreham
Reviews.Content: Really a nice hotel ,quiet one.Elegant and incredible staffs, especially nice room service. Fantastic food and wonderful amenities.Equipped with good rooms and in a perfect location.Good availability and affordable rates.Truly a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Wade044
Reviews.Content: I Booked this hotel at a last minute hotel booking agent near the square for 60 Euros 1 person. At check in I was instantly upgraded to a double room which was very cozy and comfortable. Room had a nice window that could be open to the outside for fresh air. Heat was the old radiator heater, but was really warm and cozy. Excellent hot water and great breakfast included! Internet WiFI was fast! When you walk outside to the left of the hotel there is a Dutch Super market one block or 5 minute walk. Here you can buy all kinds of local cheese and western snacks at a fraction of the tourist prices in the red light district. There are 2 coffee shop's within a 2 minute walk from the hotel door. One is located behind the hotel on a side street and the other is across the street. The hotel is located almost directly behind the Palace and is easy to walk to the Square at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: Magsy9
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, comfy & clean. Huge rooms & comfy bed. Good breaky. Very nice staff. Short walk to bars, restutaunts etc, If your walking from train station about 20min. Easier to catch a tram which is on doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachzum
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great locations to the trams. It was very clean. The people were super friendly. The breakfast in the morning was great!! The security there is tight so don't worry about anything there!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Deforestscotland
Reviews.Content: My wife, teen daughter and I stayed one night in a triple. Checkin was so smooth and fast and very helpful. Location is ideal, right near the Dam yet amazingly quiet and peaceful. We slept with windows open! Perfect night's sleep. Breakfast was much more than continental - eggs and bacon, plus good fruit. Today we go to the Anne Frank House nearby. We DEFINITELY will return!

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: Marialena P
Reviews.Content: I have visited Amsterdam many times but i never had the chance to stay in such a central hotel!Just behind the Dam Square!and it was really quiet! The room was spacious,something rare for Amsterdam! There was not any kind of decoration but who needs it when in Amsterdam?? Breakfast was included in the price and was great!! felt like real Dutch eating their local stuff! In general i loved the hotel and would deffinetely visit it again next time in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, OK hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Antuanetta
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the hotel for 1 night after cruise. I needed hotel to be close to the centraal station and lots of interesting pleces in Amsterdam, I didn't want to waist my time taking transport. I've founden what I wanted. Perfect location, friendly stuff. Rooms are OK, not great but clean. Ofcourse in case you want to spend all your time at the hotel, please, choose another one. This hotel just to drop off your begs and to go around the city :)))

Reviews.Title: “free internet and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hotel2010
Reviews.Content: good location. easy to get from the central train station to hotel. you can catch the tram from the train station and get off the second stop. Close to go by feet aswell. Internet is included, it has slow connections sometimes, but still alright to use. Breakfast is also included. Bathroom is alright. reading from the other reviews it smells? i found that it did smell of urine, butt if you left the toilet seat down it doesnt smell at all. With the towels not being fluffy, if you want fluffy towels go to a 5 star hotel. You get what you pay for. the room is quite large. and the beds are 2 single beds togheter, but if you travel around europe, you know that this is what hotels do. I found it quite clean. and beds and sheets comfortable. We were hesitant to book this hotel. so we only booked for one night to see if we wanted to extend our stay for a further 3 nights. We got here and decided to extend.

Reviews.Title: “cc stolen after stay here”
Reviews.Author: jjnjw
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok and adequate for our needs-big room, close to attractions and good breakfast. HOWEVER, our credit card number was stolen and used fraudulently after using it here. We only used it at this hotel and had not used it in awhile. Someone bought a plane ticket from Amsterdam to Detroit and charged about 1500E as well. So beware and if you stay here, don't use your CC-pay cash.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: animated
Reviews.Content: I had a less than positive experience at the Trianon hotel in Amsterdam, so I switched to the Nova Hotel. It was only a few euros more and it turned out to be a much superior experience. From the facilities to the service, it was all great! They took pride in providing good service and the room was spacious, with a private bathroom and very clean! The staff was friendly and accommodating and the location was very convenient for sightseeing. I wish I had found this place from the beginning and stayed there the whole time I was in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, brilliant location, great value friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: redjockey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid December 2009. Hotel reception very helpful, our room was very spacious, clean and lovely and warm. Bathrooms, as has been said before, are OK but basic, ours was very clean, pleanty of shampoos, etc, provided, and cleaned every day with new towels. Location brilliant - wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: CarpeDiemTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Nova Hotel in Amsterdam is in a fantastic location. Just a short walk to Dam Square. 3 canal houses put together makes the hallways kind of werid. Rooms are clean, comfortable, basic and a good size for Europe. The bathrooms need to be cleaned up of mold in the shower and don't expect fluffy towels. Good buffet breakfast included. A true 3 star hotel with value. The train does run just in front so for quiet....request a room at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Good for tourists, not so great for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: chris8tine
Reviews.Content: A pretty basic 3-star hotel, no restaurant, friendly and professional staff, good breakfast. My room was huge: it fit three single beds comfortably, and had a large fridge. Location was in a nightclub area close to the touristy areas. Cleanliness left a bit something to be desired. (Stains on the towels, etc.) For business people probably not really what you're looking for. Would be good for a group of younger people or young family looking for a roomy place to use as a base and see Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nova Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJDS1
Reviews.Content: Well located, rooms are in good condition and clean, reception was very welcoming and the security of the door being locked 24/7 was comforting. Although its on the tram line when its raining you may just get caught with your luggage, that said its in a perfect location. We walked everywhere and to everything. Some great restaurants nearby. Breakfast was fine but I would get there before 9:30 to avoid the crowd, we were late one day and got a very interesting response from the server when we asked for some clean bowls. We paid just over 100Euros a night which was pretty decent value for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Father and son from London BITTEN BY BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: NOVAHOTELEXPERIENCE
Reviews.Content: FATHER AND SON STAYING FROM 31 AUGUST 2009 - 3 SEPTEMBER 2009. VERY, VERY ANGRY. We have started in the room number 43 but at 4 a.m. we were bitten by BED BUGS and had to relocate to the romm number 102. First time in our life we have managed to catch the BED BUG and kill it, take a photo of my own finger with the DEAD BED BUG and blood. It was very itchy experience straight away after being bitten. Nobody should be jealous!!! NO APOLOGY FROM THE HOTEL!!! We were very unlucky but one star is for the good location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: SMurphyDublin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated 3 min walk from Dam square and 10 min walk from Leidsiplein( pub and club area) and 10 min walk from the train station! This hotel is clean and friendly with an amazing breakfast! Our quad room was spacious with a fridge and perfect for our stay! located on a tram line also. Having spent 4 days in Amsterdam I would recommend this hotel highly.... I would book through a price comparison website not the main hotel.... if booked out try tulip inn hotel! Nice hotel but slightly further from pubs and clubs but nearer the train station!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: lmbraun
Reviews.Content: The Nova Hotel is a charming old building in the heart of Amsterdam close to shopping and restaurants. It is clean, comfortable and the people were wonderful! I would like to caution you about the smell of urine in the Hotel. Have the maid clean your bathroom daily. It's an old building. Do not allow the hotel to do your laundry. It cost us over $100.00 for a few t-shirts and underwear. There is an especially nice little Toscana Restaurant Pizzeriaâ€Ž across the street from the Hotel. Be careful crossing the streets, the bicycles do not stop for pedestrians.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KeithMajor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and had a room on the 2nd floor overlooking the front. Somewhat noisy at nights with trams as we opened window due to no airconditioning. Room large, cleaned daily (with new towels) and comfortable. Breakfast fine - continental fayre with cereals / rolls etc. No tea / coffee facilities in room but you can buy from self dispensing machine in foyer for 1 euro. Free internet access also on ground floor. Staff friendly and helpful. The Nova is very well situated, just a few minutes from Dam Square and 15-20 minutes walk from Centraal Station. Would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good tourist class hotel near Dam square”
Reviews.Author: suvik
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy to reach from the railway station by foot ( 10-15min) or by tram. Location is pretty quiet even the hotel is situated near the Dam square and there are restaurants near by. Room is spacy and it was good to have refridgerator in the room. In May we didn't need air condition but it's a shame tah there are no A/C thinking about the summer months. Even the windows can not be opened. Room was clean, cleaning every day ( also towels were changed every day). Carpet cover the whole floor. No noice heard from other rooms, corridor and only little noice from the street even the room was towards the amin street. Service was good, very helpful. Breakfast was ok ( yougurt, juices, bread, eggs, bacon..) it was too bad that the breakfast was exactly same every day.

Reviews.Title: “Uitstekend plaats! great location, very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkiddscot
Reviews.Content: +ve Location Location Location - a stone throw from Dam but set back from road at back. good hotel - higgeldy piggely interior corridors of historic bulding , room was big and clean. staff were fine breakfast good. -ve one or two blemishes but not worth writing about Summary a good place to stay in central Amsterdam, everything is on your doorstep, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nova”
Reviews.Author: Killpop
Reviews.Content: My friends and I visited Amsterdam in Summer last year and we stayed at the Nova hotel. This hotel has a great location.. just a 2 minute walk to the centre and a very short walking distance to the other main sights. The hotel lobby was really inviting and the staff were helpful. The rooms were spacious and clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel to young travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position, cons and pros”
Reviews.Author: Sorush
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nova hotel with my wife from 9th to 13th November 2008 and had a room on the 4th floor. I had selected the hotel based on good reviews I had read about the hotel in Trip Advisor. I changed my reservation 3-4 times because of better offers by the hotel ( room price changed from 175 Euros per night to 79 Euros so I made a new reservation and cancelled the old ones each time they made a better offer which is quite normal in bookong a hotel that has no cancellation charge till 24 hrs before arrival . upon arrival I was told that My credit card was charged for the first night more than 10 days ago ! which was against what was advertised in the hotel site, they told me they did that because I had changed my reservations and they thought my credit card might be invalid !!!! I am a frequent traveler and this was the very first time this happened to me . The hotel is well situated near the Dam square with trams available from almost outside the hotel. although you can nearly reach all attractions by foot and we used tram very infrequently. On walking into my room we were impressed by the size of the room that was quite impressive for a european hotel with a window to the street , The bed sheets and the room looked clean. there was a fridge in the room that was very helpful to keep our drinks, etc in it, . Despite having the heating on full the room was somewhat cold. When I mentioned this to reception staff they said the heatings are off during the daytime and they work at night. The probable reason could be it was an attic room. My wife had tick bites on the body, something I had read in another review, but honestly I can't surely blame the hotel on it. The bathroom was sort of cold and smelt somewhat musty, the towels once smelt very bad, although when I called the reception about the problem, they kindly changed them at once, and the new ones smelt better . Breakfast was included in the room price ( unlike most hotels in Amsterdam) The contents of it was adequate and I specially loved the breakfast room,it was an old wine cave kept in the original form.The only complain is that the scrambled eggs and bacon were prepared very bad and I don't know why they do nothing about it despite all reviewers complaining about it !!! otherwise it was OK . Reception staff were very pleasant and helpful, they bought tickets for the museums,for me and they gave us city map on arrival.. The city is nice and I specially recommend Wind mill tours and Maddame Toussots and Van Gogh's meuseums to all those visiting Amsterdam. If you are on a budget and you get good promotional prices from the hotel it is a good place to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Good one”
Reviews.Author: saronca
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel. I booked a single, but I got a triple instead; it was huge, clean and looked exactly the same as in the pictures from their site. The guy at the reception was friendly, the hotel is perfectly located both for business (very close to the station, but not in the ugly part) and for leisure (packed of good restaurant around).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in excellent location - we loved it”
Reviews.Author: vikingCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Nice place in great location. The Nova Hotel is a nice place to stay if you are in Amsterdam. The english speaking staff are helpful and friendly. The rooms are clean, nice and the furniture is comfortable and in good condition. There is acces to the internet and the tv carries a variety of international channels. English and US channels are BBC1, BBC2, CNN, Discovery Channel and Euronews. English and US shows on the dutch channels are in english with dutch subtitles. The breakfast buffet is a typical hotel buffet of acceptable standard. The hotel is not suited for people with a walking disability. The nearest supermarket is on the corner of Nieuwjzids Burgwall and Paleisstraat. It is a large Albert Hein store that can fill all needs. Turn left outside the hotel and walk straight ahead. Newspapers and Magazines can be bought at Waterstones in the kalverstraat, American Book Center on Spui or the News stand next to the latter. You can also try the big kiosks at the Central Station. The nearest McDonalds is in Kalverstraat. We can recomend the italian restaurant at Paleisstraat no. 3, the french/italian cafe at no. 44/46 Nieuwendijk or the pastry shop at Hekelveld and Nieuwendijk. There are restaurants and cafes all over the area. All shopping needs can be filled locally due to the great location next to the Dam Square. If not you can take tram no.2 to the Leidsplein area. My girl friend and I liked this place and the location could not be better- We will certainly choose the Nova next time we come to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AlanPanther
Reviews.Content: A very friendly hotel situated in a very convenient location close to Dam Square and within easy walking distance of many Amsterdam attractions. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and spacious and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was plentiful with lots of choice. The security was impressive

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jhandy
Reviews.Content: Clean, smoke free, reasonably priced for location, which was a approximately two blocks from Dam Square. Had a nicer than we had expected breakfast buffet. Hotel staff very accommodating. We stayed their for 3 days before leaving on a cruise. On returning from our cruise we had a 6PM flight out of Amsterdam that same day. The hotel staff allowed us to use their luggage room while we continued sightseeing unencumbered by luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: h_andy1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location in between Dam Square and Liedesplein and within walking distance of the train station (about 10minutes). The room was very large and clean with a large and tasty breakfast included in the price. Just one thing - the weather in Amsterdam was very hot and the room didn't have air conditioning. A fan was provided but it just wasn't enough. I would stay here again but maybe not in the summer months because it was too uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: blackcard
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The staff is friendly. The location is awesome. It located close to the very center of town. When I return to Amsterdam I will definitely stay here again. After I checked in I visited many of the other hotels that are in the same price range. None of the other hotels looked nearly as nice as the Nova. My only complaint is that they do not have Free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ParisFeFe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 17th - 20th, 2008. The Hotel Nova in Amsterdam was quite nice. Not upscale, but very clean and comfortable. We lucked out and got a HUGE room - #34. It had 4 twin beds in it and a row of windows, along with a little table and 2 chairs. Also, it had a little vanity type desk, refrigerator and an armoire. Another great asset was a huge mirror in the bedroom. We did have difficulty with the electrical outlets and we even had converters and adapters. The breakfast was very good. We had the choice of scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, bacon, assortment of breads/rolls, cereals, juices, milk, coffee, and tea. The desk staff was very nice. They messed a bit on one wake up call, but otherwise they were very friendly and very helpful with directions. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Loved Loved Nova Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tashytwo
Reviews.Content: We are a young family of four (children 2 and 6) and we loved this hotel. We arrived from Australia (which took around 20 hours), at about 8 am and they advised our room was not ready, (as we had booked for later that day), but we could place our bags in the luggage room and have breakfast in the breakfast room, which was fantastic. When we got to our room we were extremely impressed. It was huge, modern and welcoming. The staff even organized a babysitter for us for 2 hours so we could experience Amsterdam at night without the children (this took a bit of organizing which we were very thankful for). We hired bikes from around the corner and rode around with the children. The tram was just outside the door. The food at breakfast was great. Overall this was a fantastic start to our European holiday. I highly recommend this hotel. Thanks Nova Hotel. P.S. It was very clean also.

Reviews.Title: “The Nova hotel is great value for money”
Reviews.Author: EnglandHappywanderer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last year, and recently before we went I read some of the reviews. I must admit I was wondering if we had done the right thing, but now we have been I am glad to say my fears were not founded. The hotel is in a good location, a short distance from Dam Square. Get the number 1,2 or 5 tram to Dam square and its only a short walk down, or get the same tram to Spui (one stop further on) and walk up Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal street. Hotel is Number 276. We got a 4 day pass that takes you on all buses, trams and metro for 17.50 euros, but you can get them for shorter periods. Get them from the information office just outside Centraal station, and this is where you get your tram from. If you don't want to take a tram you can walk down Damrak, into Dam square and then to Nieuwezijds street, but it will take you about 10 to 15 minutes. The reception staff at the hotel were all very friendly and helpful. Our room was number 501, and you took the lift and then had a few more steps and along a short corridor to our room. Not difficult. the room was extremely large, clean, with modern decor, a comfy twin or double bed, dressing table, TV, table and chairs, fridge,digital safe in the wardrobe, and a hairdryer (contrary to someone's report). The bathroom was roomy with a shower. We did have to ask for a plug but this was soon supplied. (who takes all these plugs??) The room was warm, there wasn't a radiator in the bathroom but we didn't find it too cold. Our room overlooked the street and I was tempted to ask for one at the back after reading reviews, but we didn't find the trams a problem. Yes, you could hear them in the day, but they didn't keep me awake and certainly didn't wake me up. (needed an alarm clock for that!). The breakfast buffet supplied all our needs. when they ran out of something it was quickly replaced by 2 girls who worked really hard. We don't like a big English breakfast so fruit juice, yoghurt and fruit, cereals and milk, tea, coffee, bacon sandwiches, rolls and jam set us up. there is free hot water in the machine in reception, so if you need to take some up to your room to make a drink you can. I just took my travel kettle, and little sachets of coffee, etc with me and bought milk locally. You can leave your luggage in a locked room if you need to after checking out of your room (11.00am check out). During your staty when you go out for the day you hand your room key to reception and to get it back you have to show the small card you are given when you first register. This is for extra security. We thought that for the money we paid for the room it was excellent value. Good location and friendly staff. We are young sixty year olds and have travelled to many places, so our experiences with hotels have been varied. I'd be willing to answer questions and if I can help I will.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive, but clean and big room”
Reviews.Author: martinel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right next to Dam sqare, in a quiet area. Location is more than perfect, walking distance to the main attractions (red light d, shopping, dam, bejighoff, central station, flower market, rembrandt, picasso). Don't expect the nice treats of a 180eur/night hotel. however, the room was quite large (around 18sqm) with a large bathroom, very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jencolem
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. I traveled to Amsterdam last week with 2 friends from the US and originally booked a big apartment to rent. Once we got there we determined that our apartment was too expensive, given how week the US dollar is. We walked around and our last stop was the Nova. I'm so glad we found this place. We got a triple for 90 euros w/ breakfast and couldn't have been happier. The room was nicely decorated, spacious and the beds were comfortable. We were in room 224 and had a beautiful view of the street. The breakfast was ok, nothing to brag about but served its purpose. The hotel has a lift, so to the other reviews regarding the stairs, I'm not quite sure what that's about. The staff was very helpful as well. Great bargain!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family room in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: janny1
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and we were not disappointed. We had a very clean spacious family room with proper beds for four people which seems to be extremely unusual. The room was at the back of the hotel so no view but it was quiet. It was great that the whole hotel is smokefree - unusual for Amsterdam which is somewhat behind the times in the smokefree stakes. The location is great - we walked everywhere very easily but its also central for trams. Its very close to Dam Square but at the nicer end of the street and we didn't have any problems with noise or feeling unsafe at night. Good selection of restaurants in the neighbouring streets and a truly amazing beer shop (the Cracked Kettle) a couple of streets away. We arrived in Amsterdam by car and used the Park and Ride at the Olympic Stadium and travelled in by tram getting off at Dam Square - a 5 minute walk from the hotel (it was only 6 Euros for 24 hours including travel tickets for two people to get into the city - can stay up to 4 days and gives a huge saving on parking prices in the city - also saves on the nerves as its not a good city to drive in from past experience!)

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel breakfast brill”
Reviews.Author: dandelion8
Reviews.Content: Great hotel close to shops, transport ,room twin, very large ,large breakfast sets you off for the day, staff most helpful,no problems would go back my first time here and loved it

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 21st birthday in the dam”
Reviews.Author: handleyr
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip through the BMI Baby website who I used to book flights with. It worked out being about â‚¬60 for a double room per night inc continental breakfast. This trip was for my 21st birthday with my girlfriend. It was brilliant. Id never been to Amsterdam before really and was very much looking forward to it. I was not to be disappointed. The hotel was really easy to find. Tram from Centraal Station to the Dam then a 2 minute walk up the cobbled street (not good if your dragging casesâ€¦.). The hotel is quite a small place built in an old building, though it is very nice and kept basis but always clean. On arrival, we were 3 hours early for check in, the receptionist took our bags. Then let us roam round dam until our room was ready. Check in was meant to be at 2 but our room was to be ready for half 12 so returned from the Dam to find our bags had been taken to the rooms, making check in easy. The room was big, plenty of space to get round the bed, there was even a table and chairs in the room as well as make up table for her and there was also a medium sized fridge. The bed was really comfy. The bathroom was big enough, nice powerful shower, plenty of bath towels which is always nice. The toilet was separate to the bathroom, not sure why but it didnâ€™t cause a problem. The rooms are all none smoking, but there are windows. Breakfast was on the ground floor in the lobby area, continental breakfast so not really my favourite but I managed on the cereals and toast available. You may want to try Barneys if your after good morning food, I went there twice and it was really good grub. I would put more but tripadvisor guidelines prevent me, contact me for more details. Make sure you visit Anne Franks yard and the X-tra Cold Heineken Ice Bar, as well as the Red Light District and Coffee Shops. Iv booked back to go the dam in March with the Mrs again, this time staying at Hotel Orlando as we couldnâ€™t get a good deal on the Nova Hotel, although I wouldnâ€™t hesitate at staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and central”
Reviews.Author: Michel-B-62
Reviews.Content: Central and within walking distance of main attractions and centre. Renovated rooms as really nice. Car park very close.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location BUT”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Overseas
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend away in Amsterdam - location was exception, but be prepared for less from this hotel than you'd expect with the pricetag! Room was a good size, and quiet, which was great, however the staircase leading up was a death trap. For a non-smoking hotel the corridor reaked of cigarette smoke, and the accommodation areas were generally dark and pretty dingy. That said, bedding was clean, mattress comfortable and the staff very friendly. Really good shopping in the area. I would recommend it, if only for the location and convenience. but with the proviso that you you expect not much in the way of decadence or display!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: traveller882
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for one night. Its located just behind Dam square and is within walking distance to Centraal Station or any of the major attractions. We arrived early in the morning and although the room wasnt ready we could book in and leave our bags in a locked room for the day. We had a triple room which was huge. The breakfast isn't great but the staff were friendly and helpful. If you come out of the hotel and head right towards dam square there is a supermarket (it has big marble-ish steps outside) and is handy for buying bottled water etc. The tram tickets from the supermarket are also cheaper than they are to buy on the tram itself. We spent the saturday in amsterdam and took the train to the Hague on the Sunday. Brilliant trip and the Nova hotel was an ideal place to stay for the night!!

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Ravind
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with simple European breakfast. Clean beddings. The place is very central and just a few minutes by tram to everywhere. New people to Amsterdam should take tram 2 or 5 and get off at the Dam. Great location for everything. Good hotel for family - relatively large rooms for 4 people Ravind & Veenita Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: naney2
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel it was situated within 5 minutes walking distance to the Dam Square and all its splendor. The hotel was clean and comfortable, room 304 was spacious and there was no noise as it is situated at the back, no good if you want a view. Breakfast was adequate, Reception were excellent and extremely helpful when asked if they could tell us where we could use internet check in at the airport they did it for us and printed out our boarding passes. Where the hotel is situated is perfect to get out and about to all the wonderful museums and shopping areas. Would recommend this hotel and definately stay there again. Chris and Elaine UK

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: bookem28
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night with my wife. Great value hotel, payed only 89 euro including breakfast. Our room was huge (superior comfort double, rm 304), very clean, and with some nice modern touches. Bathroom was a reasonable size with a good shower. The view from our room was not great, but we didn't care as we weren't there to stay in our room and look out the window. The hotel is very close to most of the main attractions, but is at the quieter end of the street. The hotel also feels very secure, the front door is locked at all times and requires a buzz-in from the front desk. The left-luggage room is also always locked and requires a swipe-card from the front-desk to get in. All in-all a very good, very comfortable hotel and I would definitely stay again, and recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, safe, clean hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: HighHeels_7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night for me and my son and his girlfriend so we could spend a day exploring Amsterdam before attending a concert at the Melkweg. The family room was spacious, attractive, comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful; great location a minute's walk from Dam Square, and with frequent trams just outside to Centraal station (a ten-minutes walk away) and to the Melkweg. There is a nice cafe on the corner of the same street. (CafÃ© van Daele). Secure entry to the hotel, with staff on the desk all night. I will use this hotel again in future. EB.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic break”
Reviews.Author: mimessex
Reviews.Content: For a twoT plus hotel the Nova was perfect. We went with friends but had rooms on different floors but both were great, spacious and very clean. The only thing we would improve on would be tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms instead of paying for it in a machine in the lobby. Breakfasts were fine with plenty of it. Reception staff were brillaint giving excellent advice on day trips, even booking them for us with discounts. The candlelight cruise, Heineken experience and Anne Franks house are all worth visiting. Even the Red Light district was amusing. We would definately stay here again if we came back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: littlefrank
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Nova. We had room 401 which was a very spacious room at the front of the hotel. which great if you can tolerate the tram noise. We cannot fault anything about this hotel, the location was excellent, not far to walk to anywhere. The hotel is about 15 minute walk to Central Station, don't make the mistake of having a taxi as we got charged almost â‚¬20 for the journey, which is a bit of a rip off. Should I return to Amsterdam, i will be booking into this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally non smoking hotel”
Reviews.Author: funkeyminiman
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Hotel Nova, which has just become one of the first totally non smoking hotels in the Netherlands. This must be our 6th visit to this hotel and our reason for returning are the following Location - This hotel is round the corner from Dam Sq, across the road from a major supermarket and is centrally located to most attractions. There is a tram stop over the road for those who don't fancy walking Rooms - Our favourite room is 501 which it at the top of the oldest part of the building looking over the main road. Room is large and comes with a double bed, TV and fridge. Yes you can hear the trams but that is part of the charm Food - Price included continental breakfast, (meats, cheese, rolls, fruits etc) Staff - Very friendly always willing to help Weather - For a change we had cold sunny weather rather than rain, If you plan to visit during the winter months make sure you take layers with you including a waterproof and hat a scarf. Because of the water it does get pretty chilly. Attractions - Would recommend the standard high profile attractions but would also recommend, Boom Chicago for a good laugh. Also visit the Cannibis college for some interesting facts on hemp and to the see the garden. Food - The pancake bakery is a must and Chicanos if you like a good steak or racks of ribs. Cafes - Dampkring is a must followed by Barneys and the Green house.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: DavidAilie
Reviews.Content: My fiance Ailie and I spent three nights at the Nova 15th - 18th December 2006, Had room 34 (Massive Room facing the street) Absolutely no complaints, Clean towels every day, full sized fridge,Rooms Clean and well furnished. Hotel staff friendly and very helpfull. Excellent location (1 minute stroll to Dam square). We would definately use the Nova again and would recommend to anyone looking for a good hotel in the heart of Amsterdam..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nova - excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Nors07
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my boyfriend and we thought it was an excellent hotel. Would definately return. its very central, near dam Square and central Station. Room 14 was very large and comfortable. I couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: maryclaude2
Reviews.Content: Well, I had a great time here...again. This is the third time I've stayed in the Nova Hotel and it's the first one I thought of when I went on a solo trip this time. This hotel is central to everything but not in the busiest street. It also has the advantage of being quite close to one of my favourite restaurants, the 'Kantijl and Tiger', for yummy Indonesian food. When I arrived, I was immediately given my key and directed to the lift, which is tiny but very efficient. I had booked a comfort room and when I walked in........it was just lovely! Twin beds pushed together with white sheets and a big wooden headboard. Three huge windows, looking down onto the street. Bathroom, fridge, table and chairs, TV. It was an enormous room and very comfortable. Breakfast is a cold buffet of fruit, cereal, cheese, cold meats, rolls and toast. I found the staff, as always, to be friendly and helpful. I had asked for a smoking room and was given a non-smoking room but was promised a new one in the morning. They rang me before breakfast, to ask me did I want to move but by then I was attached to my room and couldn't imagine that they could give me a better one. Altogether I would recommend this hotel, although I was tempted to write nothing and keep it as much of a secret as possible, so it isn't booked up next time I go.....:-) I would say though, shop around online. There are very good deals to be had and go for the comfort rooms if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: annie999
Reviews.Content: We arrived to check into this hotel and had to leave. The room we were shown to was dirty and smelled really bad. We were shown to a second room but unfortunately it was as bad if not worse. The receptionist was unpleasant and unfriendly and I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience...”
Reviews.Author: clemus
Reviews.Content: Sorry to say but this hotel was not a three star level, it smelled bad and got worse as you traveled beyond the lobby (a mix between mildew, marijuana and smoke) and our room had a leak of some sort that would flood our room floor every day. The rug on the floor had gotten moldy and created issues with breathing. On our last day they offered a new room, but that would mean carrying our luggage up and down these tiny little stairs to who knows where so we said no and just sucked it up another night. I would have thought they would offer to move our bags for us at the very least... The breakfast was ok, a bunch of bread and cheese; we ended up going elsewhere to cut the carbs. The staff was nice enough, but I felt this hotel was unclean, smelly and depressing. Search elsewhere...I will never stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: mairesinead
Reviews.Content: I am just back from Amsterdam last Friday and I booked a "spacious comfort room" at the Nova hotel costing me 155 euro a night. The room was a large room with two big single beds put together, the bathroom was small but catered for a bath/shower. The room also had a t.v which had some dutch channels and english channels and you also had the option of paying 12.50 a night for a few film channels. The room also contained a fridge however the view from our window was terrible but I was on holiday and spent most of the time outside and not looking out my window so I didn't mind. The Nova hotel also has a safety deposit box for every room and it is downstairs and it is of no extra cost. There was no noise and the people at reception rang for a taxi.The breakfast was sufficent. There was toast and many types of bread,cheese, turkey,all hot drinks, juice,fruit salad and cereal.All around, the Nova hotel was worth the stay as it was 1 minute from Dam square and everything leads off from there. I hope this has been of some help.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The Fatbloke
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel over a weekend in May '06, found th staff to be friendly and helpfull Security was good as you had to be let in and out of the main door on a buzzer system. The hotel was pleasantly furnished, although the lurid green walls at breakfast where bit much at breakfast, especially after a night on the alcohol. Talking of which there is no "in-house" bar, however the location is such that there is no problem with that. A resonable sized lift is available for the ascent to the rooms, The rooms where clean and tidy, the one we had was a bit crowded with a table in the room, twin beds pushed together, and a fridge as well as a wardrobe. tv in the room giving all the usual channels plus BBC1 and 2 a bonus for us Brits. the toilet was seperate from the Shower room making it better for two people when one is being used. Our room overlooked the back of the Hotel and as has been stated in an earlier review, a bit bleak, but no more so than any other in a tightly packed city centre. the room was surprisingly quiet, no noise heard of returning revellers during the night and only the cleaning staff allowing a fire door to shut broke the slumber (it was an acceptable 08:00hrs). This is not the cheapest hotel in Amsterdam, but a hostel it isn't. it is good value, excellent location, no more than 10 minutes walk to any major area, unless you started looking in shops. Breakfast is normal continental, buffet style and you can help yourself to whatever, is available. I would recommend this hotel to the person who can aford more than budget , but maybe not "The Grand".

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam: Nova Hotel Amsterdam: "not good value"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights in early April 06, having booked it on Octopus, cost - Â£300+ it is the most overpriced hotel that I ever have stayed in ,I stayed in room 16 which faced onto the back of the hotel with a view like Beruit, The noise from the above room was unbearable I complained asked for a different room but no joy the hotel was full, This hotel is defiantly not in the top league 3 star hotels, it might have a lift & be near to all the attractions which Amsterdam has to offer but thatâ€™s about all whatâ€™s going for it, take my advice & look elsewhere, the breakfast was very basic but there was enough choice so you wouldnâ€™t starve, However we found all the hotel staff friendly polite and helpful, Most of hotel guests where students but well behaved ones, stay at this hotel as a last resort or if you get the price down to halve what I paid Oh before I forget (the kitchen staff shoud be trained to put disposable gloves on before handling the food at breakfast it was disgusting to watch them Sorry to slag this hotel off but Iam just being honest

Reviews.Title: “Great location & pleasently surprised”
Reviews.Author: diderek
Reviews.Content: We found the Nova really central and walking distance to any attractions and the railway station. Very close to Dam square and a supermarket just down the road, so the fridge would come in handy in summer. Tea & Coffee facilities would be my only improvement. We felt very secure with the front door locked at all times and the locked luggage storage facility also came in handy. The staff were very helpful and booked a tour for us as well. The room was ncely decorated and had plenty of room for the 3 of us who stayed. Would recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and safe but near the action”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights in early November, 2005. Even though we are over 60 we walked from Central Station to the hotel in less than a half hour with backpacks and rolling, carry-on sized suitcases. I decided on this hotel based on location and TripAdvisor reviews. We paid a total of $365.58 for two nights in room 31 on the third floor including a good continental style breakfast, all taxes, and Hotel service fee. The room had two twin beds pushed together, a small table, desk, TV, and small refridgerator. The toilet was in a separate space (I barely fit in) from the shower and sink (no tub). Basic toiletries were provided. Good towels. Wash cloths are not common in Europe and were not provided. The beds were somewhat lumpy but we were always very tired from walking and we slept well with the windows open. The Nova was our first taste of European style bedding - no top sheet, just a comforter with a case on it. The elevator is very tiny and my wife and I (I'm 6'2", 250lbs.) could just fit in with our small amount of luggage. We walked everywhere from the hotel - the dam, red light district, Chinatown, and even into the residential districts. We felt very safe at all times. The tram was riden twice, which stops about a half block from the hotel. Be sure and take a canal tour by boat! Our last morning we had to catch an early train at Central Station and were planning on taking the tram but was told it did not run at the early time we needed to leave so the desk clerk called a taxi and negotiated a price of seven euros for the short trip. We felt the Nova to be very adequate for our needs and would stay there again but bring our own wash cloths!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnneTyneside_England
Reviews.Content: Nova hotel in good location near dam square. All the sights easily accessible. The room was clean with adaquate furnishings including fridge, the breakfast was OK but nothing special. The friendly reception staff were extremely helpful. The many flights of stairs to bedroom may cause a problem to the less agile as it was difficult to carry luggage in and out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: notakid
Reviews.Content: For the price we were really pleased with the Hotel Nova. Its location was brilliant next to Dam Square and there was a large supermarket afew doors down. The reception was helpful and the breakfast basic but good. Lots of choice with chocolate sprinkes for the kids. Our room was huge, no view but why bother to look out the window when you are so close to everything. We also had a full sized fridge which was unusual but welcome. Our only problem was on the last day. My daughter left her bag in the room as we vacated it we her and her brothers game boys in it. When we reliesed we went back but it had disappeared. Reception were helpful and even rang the police for us. We just had enough time to report the theft before flying home. Don't let this put you off the hotel however as it could have happened anywhere just be careful with your stuff (unlike us)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nova Hotel in Amsterdam last winter (2003-2004) and had a terrific time. The hotel is located in a very central location, close to all the shops, museums, restaurants, and major attractions. The staff was very friendly and had all the answers and great suggestions. The room was very clean, quite big, and very comfortable. Excellent breakfast in the morning really fills you up for the day. Found a terrific last minute deal on this hotel and had a really great time. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Hotel - 4 Star Location”
Reviews.Author: Jan_from_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: Although thie hotel carries a 3 star rating, the overall quality of the Nova is more in keeping with a 2 start facility. Our room was basic but adequate, the free breakfast offers a broad selection of items, and the staff was very helpful and responsive. The location is indeed excellent and is only steps from the Dam, a large supermarket, and lots of eating options. The tram runs right by the hotel with stops nearby in both directions. If you want a view then ask for a front window (with street noise). We stayed inside but still found the building to be a bit noisy with hearing doors closing, people walking etc. Our room had three twin beds and some have four so this is a good spot for those who can use such bed configurations. The hotel is undergoing renovation one floor at a time but that was not a problem. If this still sounds appealing then look for 2 star pricing on the room- not 3 star. We stayed 5 nights in December and finally nailed down via Internet a double rate of 75 Euros (half of the brochure price). Last-minute walk-ins did even better, if that is an option in your travels.

HotelInfo.Name: Nova Hotel Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 276, Amsterdam 1012 RS, The Netherlands
